Hello! Newbie here <bows> Glad to have joined, there seem to be such a lot =
of knowledgeable people around.
 
As such, I have a few questions, or rathe=
r a few things I'd like to have confirmed/dismissed, on what I've read so f=
ar about Hijikata's early life. (I have a special fondness for him - all th=
e Shinsengumi boys are interesting, but this one's special!)
 
This is what=
 I've found so far:
-Full name: Hijikata Toshizou Yoshitoyo. (Anyone know i=
f he had another childhood name, or if he ever changed it later in life?)
 =

- He was the youngest of 6 children, and had 3 brothers and 2 sisters. The=
 younger sister's name was Onobu (she later married Sato Hikogorou). I read=
 somewhere that the oldest brother's name was Kiroku, and the Shinsengumi! =
NHK series gives another brother's name as Tamajirou. 
 
- According to one=
 site, both his parents died when he was very young (IIRC it even said that=
 his father was already dead by the time Toshizou was born). The older of h=
is sisters also died early.
 
- Toshizou was raised first by his brother Ki=
roku, then moved to Onobu's home at the age of 11. This was also the time h=
e lost his first job, through being disrespectful to his employer.
 
- I un=
derstand he got to know (the future) Kondou Isami when they were both in th=
eir late teens. Sources differ on whether he joined the Tennen Rishin ryuu =
at this time, and simply didn't become a *resident* student until later, or=
 if he didn't in fact join until he was 28 (I think that's the right age).
=
 
- He lost another job at 17, this time he was working at a clothing store=
, and got fired for sleeping with one of his female co-workers. It was afte=
r this that his brother in law helped him set himself up as a medicine pedd=
ler. 
 
So... right, wrong, what?
 
Oh, and a bonus question <grins> Does a=
nyone know much about the relationship between Hijikata and Okita Souji? Mo=
st sources I've found mention how the original Shieikan four were "like bro=
thers"... but two people I've debated with (admitted, people who really dis=
like the way Shinsengumi manga/anime tend to turn those two into a couple) =
claim that it's "well known" that Hijikata and Okita didn't get along. Whic=
h, granted, isn't exactly antithetic to their being foster brothers - you s=
hould see my family! - but I wondered if anyone could shed some light on th=
e topic.
 
Linda/Enma-Ou
